newsitem.title: SOUTH AFRICA: SOCCER-DUNDEE "DEFECTION" TO GERMANY STIRS MPS.
newsitem.headline: SOCCER-DUNDEE "DEFECTION" TO GERMANY STIRS MPS.

text.p: South African Sports Minister Steve Tshwete on Tuesday rejected calls from members of parliament to make diplomatic representations to the German government over the Sean Dundee case.
Members of parliament's sports and recreation portfolio committee expressed their alarm at the decision of South African-born soccer star Dundee to pledge his international future to Germany.
Dundee has made his home in Germany havng established himself as one the country's top strikers with Bundesliga side Karlsruhe.
Tshwete told MPs at a briefing that the government would not become directly involved but that it would back whatever action the South African Football Association decided to take.
"I think the federation must grab hold of this matter," he told MPs. "We would like them to take the initiative and then they will get the full backing of the government."
